column5: Where do you find that info? This may hijack the thread a little, but if an American wants to take a mortgage on a Canadian cottage, what's the process?

A 1.5% interest rate sounds attractive, but you have to realize that Gord was not telling the whole story, Government rates and what the average consumer pays are entirely two different things. You will find after everything is factored in, that long term mortgage rates in Canada are currently not much different than the US (Google can answer all your questions about rates). My guess (and only a guess) is that most Canadian lending institutions would only finance a small % at best, unless you have other assets in Canada that the lending institution can hold the paper on. Another thing to consider is the cost of converting US currency to Canadian, the published exchange rates do not include the cost of the transaction, it is a crazy amount percentage-wise for what amounts to be no more than a click of the mouse in a millisecond.
